# docker_compose (Data Source)

Use this data source to get information about a Docker Compose stack.

## Example Usage

```terraform
# Get information about an existing Docker Compose stack
data "docker_compose" "myapp" {
  project_name = "myapp"
}

output "running_services" {
  value = data.docker_compose.myapp.running_services
}

output "total_services" {
  value = data.docker_compose.myapp.total_services
}

output "services" {
  value = data.docker_compose.myapp.services
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `project_name` (String) The name of the Docker Compose project.

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The ID of this resource.
- `running_services` (Number) Number of running services in the stack.
- `services` (Block List) List of services in the compose stack. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--services))
- `total_services` (Number) Total number of services in the stack.

<a id="nestedblock--services"></a>
### Nested Schema for `services`

Read-Only:

- `container_id` (String) Container ID.
- `health` (String) Container health status.
- `image` (String) Image used by the service.
- `name` (String) Service name.
- `ports` (String) Port mappings.
- `state` (String) Container state (running, exited, etc.).
- `status` (String) Container status.
